en.game_credits_third_party_assets_2: Game Developer Studio - Mega Laboratory Pack
en.game_credits_third_party_assets_4: Game Developer Studio - UI Game Icon Collection
en.game_credits_third_party_assets_5: Game Developer Studio - Bursts and Rays
en.game_credits_third_party_assets_6: Game Developer Studio - Icons for Games - Game Asset Pack
en.game_credits_third_party_assets_7: Humble Bundle - Game Dev Market - Acasas - Futuristic User Interface
en.game_content_act_i_introduction_dialogue: You must be the new {na1} I've been expecting.
You must be the new geneticist I've been expecting.
I'm professor Randall, the resident doctor on-site.
Let me update your {gm1} firmware with our new {na2} so you can integrate with our new systems...
Let me update your heads up display firmware with our new science packages so you can integrate with our new systems...
en.game_content_narrative_introduction_dial: Prof. Randall
Alright now that we've updated your {gm1}, let me show you around...
Alright now that we've updated your heads up display, let me show you around...
HUD
Prof. Randall
Lets start with our history that describes what we do in the {na1} and why...
Lets start with our history that describes what we do in the biogenetics laboratory and why...
Biogenetics Laboratory
Prof. Randall
The {na1} was first founded in the year 2351 by {na2}!
The laboratory was first founded in the year 2351 by Doctor Allthric Egon!
Biogenetics Laboratory
Dr. Uthric Egon
Prof. Randall
You see, {na1} was curious to know how alien creatures adapt and survive on different planets.
You see, Doctor Allthric Egon was curious to know how alien creatures adapt and survive on different planets.
Dr. Uthric Egon
Prof. Randall
From that moment on, our mission has been dedicated solely to the learning and discovery of genetics in-order to map {ed1} across the cosmos!
From that moment on, our mission has been dedicated solely to the learning and discovery of genetics in-order to map phenotypes across the cosmos!
Phenotypes
Prof. Randall
Which brings us to the experiments...
Which brings us to the experiments...
en.game_content_experiments_introduction_di: As you can see, from your newly updated {gm1}, we have three experiments we can run.
As you can see, from your newly updated heads up display, we have three experiments we can run.
Each experiment serves a different purpose, which helps us in our mission to learn more about alien genetics.
Each experiment serves a different purpose, which helps us in our mission to learn more about alien genetics.
Lets investigate what each experiment is about now...
Lets investigate what each experiment is about now...
en.game_content_experiments_chromosome_harv: A {gm1} is about breaking down {ed1} in-order to learn more about the inner workings of {ed2}.
A chromosome harvest experiment is about breaking down chromosomes in-order to learn more about the inner workings of genes.
en.game_content_experiments_gene_translatio: A {gm1} is about building {ed1} in-order to learn more about how {ed2} are transformed into {ed3}.
A gene translation experiment is about building dna segments in-order to learn more about how genes are transformed into proteins.
en.game_content_experiments_trait_replicati: A {gm1} is about simulating {ed1} in-order to learn more about the physical characteristics of {ed2}.
A trait replication experiment is about simulating organisms in-order to learn more about the physical characteristics of traits.
en.game_content_experiments_conclusion_dial: Great work. With this new information let us move on to {gm1} device...
Great work. With this new information let us move on to the helidex device...
en.game_content_helidex_introduction_dialog: The {gm1} is our genetic database and central hub for our experiments.
The helidex is our genetic database and central hub for our experiments.
The {gm1} handles and holds all the genetic information and data we have collected, so we can continue to learn-as-we-grow.
The helidex handles and holds all the genetic information and data we have collected, so we can continue to learn as we grow.
Within the {gm1} lies critical information about our research in-respect of the {ed1}, {ed2} and {ed3} we have studied and produced.
Within the helidex lies critical information about our research in-respect of the genes, traits and organisms we have studied and produced.
Let's {gm1} the {gm2}, and discover what we will be doing today...
Let's open the helidex, and discover what we will be doing today...
en.game_content_helidex_game_objective_intr: The focus for our experiments will be on the {na1}!
The focus for our experiments will be on the teumessian fox!
The {na1} is a alien creature that holds unique genetic properties that we wish to study and learn about.
The teumessian fox is a alien creature that holds unique genetic properties that we wish to study and learn about.
These learnings will help our genetic {ed1} algorithm simulate different {ed2} and {ed3} in {ed4}.
These learnings will help our genetic splicing algorithm simulate different genes and traits in organisms.
Feel free to investigate the {gm1} database entry for the {na1} to learn more.
Feel free to investigate the helidex database entry for the teumessian fox to learn more.
When you're ready to continue, simply {gm1} the {gm2}.
When you're ready to continue, simply close the helidex.
en.game_content_helidex_game_tip_dialogue_1: To {gm1} the {gm2}, simply {gm3} with the terminal.
To open the helidex, simply interact with the terminal.
en.game_content_helidex_game_tip_dialogue_2: To {gm1} the {gm2}, simply {gm3} with the {gm4} button.
To close the helidex, simply interact with the close button.
en.game_content_helidex_game_tip_dialogue_3: To {gm1} around the {gm2} database, simply {gm3} with the {gm4} buttons.
To navigate around the helidex database, simply interact with the navigation buttons.
en.game_content_helidex_fennec_learning_obj: The {na1} is a quadrupedal alien species that was discovered in 2352, and are indigenous to the planet known as {na2}!
The teumessian fox is a quadrupeedal alien species that was discovered in 2352, and are indigenous to the planet known as apollo thirteen!
These {ed1} host {ed2} and {ed3} that have a higher than normal rate for {ed4}...
These organisms host genes and traits that have a higher than normal rate for cellular adaptivity...
The current status of the alien species known as {na1} is emergent.
The current status of the alien species known as fennec vulpes is emergent.

The reason for the emergent classification states that due to their unique {ed1}, the species has the potential to survive in a variety of different {ed2}, meaning a greater chance for growth and sustainability.

The reason for the emergent classification states that due to their unique genome, the species has the potential to survive in a variety of different habitats, meaning a greater chance for growth and sustainability.
en.game_content_helidex_conclusion_dialogue: If you ever get stuck, refer back to the {gm1} for more information about your current {gm2}...
If you ever get stuck, refer back to the helidex for more information about your current objectives...
en.game_content_act_i_conclusion_dialogue_1: This concludes our lab induction and orientation.
This concludes our lab induction and orientation.
en.game_content_act_i_conclusion_dialogue_2: Come talk with me when you're ready to start experimenting...
Come talk with me when you're ready to start experimenting...
en.game_content_act_ii_introduction_dialogu: Lets start by investigating what a {gm1} is...
Lets start by investigating what a harvesting experiment is...
en.game_content_chromosome_harvest_experime: Welcome to your very first chromosome harvest experiment!
Let's familiarise you with the experimental processes...
Let's familiarise you with the experimental processes...
Chromosome harvesting involves slicing chromosomes in order to produce gene samples!
This experiment has been built from the following scientific principles...
This experiment has been built from the following scientific principles...
An {ed1} is any living thing that exists in the world.
An organism is any living thing that exists in the world.
A {ed1} can be a very small {ed2} called a {ed3}.
A cell can be a very small organism called a single celled organism.
An {ed1} that is made up of structures of {ed2} is called a {ed3}.
An organism that is made up of structures of cells is called a multi-cellular organism.
Within a cell lies a nucleus.
Within a nucleus lies multiple chromosomes.
Within each chromosome lies hundreds of genes.
Within each {ed1} lies a segment of {ed2}.
Within each gene lies a segment of DNA.
Fun fact number one: A human is a complex multi cellular organism.
Fun fact number two: A chromosome actually comes in pairs.
Fun fact number three: A human has twenty three pairs of chromosomes.
Fun fact number four: A gene encodes a segment of DNA.
But how does all of this fit into the experiment you ask...?
But how does all of this fit into the experiment you ask...?
Well let me show you an example of the science in practice...
Well let me show you an example of the science in practice...
Alright now your turn. Have a go at the experiment...
Alright now your turn. Have a go at the experiment...
{gm1} as many {gm2} as you can before {gm3} runs out!
Slice as many chromosomes as you can before time runs out!
Amazing work! Let's check the report logs to see how you did.
Amazing work! Let's check the report logs to see how you did.
en.game_content_act_ii_conclusion_dialogue_: From your efforts here today, I've begun compiling all of the information we have learnt to help you understand what to do in the future...
From your efforts here today, I've begun compiling all of the information we have learnt to help you understand what to do in the future...
en.game_content_chromosome_harvest_experime: {gm1} through {ed1} to break down genetic material!
Slice through chromosomes to break down genetic material!
Spend genetic material to create genes!
Create as many {ed1} as possible, before {gm1} runs out.
Create as many genes as possible, before time runs out.
en.game_content_act_iii_introduction_dialog: Let's now run a {gm1} to learn more about this experiment...
Let's now run a gene translation experiment to learn more about this experiment...!
en.game_content_gene_translation_experiment: Welcome to your very first gene translation experiment!
Let's familiarise you with the experimental processes...
Let's familiarise you with the experimental processes...
A {gm1} involves {gm2} and {gm3} {ed1} in-order to complete {ed2}!
A gene translation experiment involves changing and matching nucleotides in-order to complete genes!
This experiment is based upon the following scientific principles and knowledge...
This experiment is based upon the following scientific principles and knowledge...
{ed1} are made up of {ed2} which is the genetic blueprint that encodes all {ed3}!
Genes are made up of DNA which is the genetic blueprint that encodes all organisms!
{ed1} is made up of strands and segments that form a {ed2} genetic chain.
DNA is made up of strands and segments that form a double-helix shaped genetic chain.
A {ed1} is made up of pairs of {ed2} (or {ed3}) and {ed4}.
A DNA segment is made up of pairs of nitrogen bases (or nucleotides) and hydrogen bonds.
A {ed1} has only four base types which are known as {ed2}, {ed3}, {ed4}, and {ed5}.
A nucleotide has only four base types which are known as adenine, thymine, cytosine, and guanine.
In-order for {ed1} to form between {ed2}, the respective {ed3} must follow the specific genetic pairing rules!
In-order for hydrogen bonds to form between nucleotides, the respective nucleotide pairs must follow the specific genetic pairing rules!
{gm1}: A {ed1} {ed2} can only pair with a {ed3} {ed4}!
Rule number one: An adenine nucleotide can only pair with a thymine nucleotide!
{gm1}: A {ed1} {ed2} can only pair with a {ed3} {ed4}!
Rule number two: A cytosine nucleotide can only pair with a guanine nucleotide!
These genetic pairing rules are the foundation for how {ed1} form in {ed2} which is necessary for {ed3} {ed4} into {ed5}.
These genetic pairing rules are the foundation for how amino acid sequences form in DNA which is necessary for translating genes into proteins.
These {ed1} are then used to generate the physical characteristics seen in {ed2}, which are known as {ed3}.
These proteins are then used to generate the physical characteristics seen in organisms, which are known as traits.
But how does all of this fit into the experiment you ask...?
But how does all of this fit into the experiment you ask...?
Well let me show you an example of the science in practice...
Well let me show you an example of the science in practice...
{gm1} as many {ed2} into {ed3} to create new {ed3} before {gm2} runs out!
Translate as many genes into proteins to create new traits before time runs out!
Let's head back to the {gm1} and implement our new {ed1}...
Let's head back to the biogenetics laboratory and implement our new traits...
Don't sweat however, as all of this information we have summarised and compiled for you, to help you understand what to do in the experiment...
Don't sweat however, as all of this information we have summarised and compiled for you, to help you understand what to do in the experiment...
Form new {ed1} and {ed2} by matching up {ed3} on the {ed4}.
Form new nucleotide pairs and hydrogen bonds by matching up nucleotides on the DNA segment.
Translate genes into proteins to synthesize new traits.
en.game_content_act_iii_conclusion_dialogue: From your efforts we have uncovered the secrets behind the {na1} {ed1}!
From your efforts we have uncovered the secrets behind the teumessian fox cellular adaptivity!
en.game_content_biogenetics_laboratory_on_t: Remember to check your {gm1} to understand what to do...
Remember to check your helidex to understand what to do...
en.game_content_biogenetics_laboratory_on_g: Well done! You've successfully harvested enough {ed1} and synthesized enough {ed2} for our simulator to create a {gm1}!
Well done! You've successfully harvested enough genes and synthesized enough traits for our simulator to create a teumessian fox!
You have accomplished so much! Don't forget what you've learnt here today.
You have accomplished so much! Don't forget what you've learnt here today.
